reviews.text: The hotel itself has nothing to write home about. Hostel looking lobby. Very small room even for Japanese standard. They don't even have shower gel in the bathroom (tiny bar soap instead), and shampoo comes in a little packet. Wifi signal in the room can be inconsistent, but they do have a broadband outlet you can plug in your mobile modem. Staff is helpful though. However, the location is great. 5 min walk to the JR station (cut through the Osaka Front mall) or 3 min walk to the subway line. Good restaurant options if walking towards the Hankyu station/ Hep 5 mall area, which is less expensive than the JR station area.
reviews.title: Good location bare bone business hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this hotel. It's about a block from the main train station (with JR lines) and the rooms were huge. They had wired internet access. The rooms were very clean and didn't have any odor. It had a very cool "loft" feel, which we liked. It had exposed concrete and pretty minimalist decor.
reviews.title: LOVE this hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beware: when we booked on Agoda, I thought I put in 2 guests, but I guess I didn't. When we showed up, they made me pay $40 USD extra for the second person. If I had known, I would have just checked in myself and had my wife show up later. You only get 1 key anyway. Anyway, even with the $40 it was still very inexpensive (about $105). I highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Functional
Good value-for-money. Great location to get to Kansai Airport.
reviews.text: Really close to the train station (2 streets). Convinience stores in 20 m. Vending machines inside the hotel. Nice personnel, who can barely speak english but will do their best to help you. Relatively close to the attractions in the city (metro required). Not close to the metro entrance, but it's only 10 minutes walk away.

Extremely clean and functional room. Don't expect extras. It's a business hotel and it's not prepared to host the same person for a lot of nights. Small bathroom but fitting the standards of the japanese hotels. The room is not huge, but it's got some space for you and the cases to move. No closet, just a couple of hangers.
reviews.title: Great value!
